oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photographic plate of 1918 Old Hickory Powder Plant
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A copper photographic plate of a building at the 1918 Old Hickory Powder Plant, possibly a dormitory. Written on the reverse: "Powder Plant / Old Hickory Apartment / Before '28' / Found Behind Stage OHES (Old Hickory Elementary School) / Rest May Have Been In Fire." DuPont, under contract to the US Army, operated the largest gunpowder plant in the world during WWI. The plant closed in 1919 but DuPont returned in 1928. Arson took DuPont High School and Dupont Elementary in 1967.
